summary: This is an email chain from January 2019 regarding the setup of a Relativity database for the case 'U.S. v. Epstein'. The correspondence involves an Assistant U.S. Attorney from New York coordinating the upload of initial FBI case files and preparing for a larger batch of documents.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney of New York
persons.context: The sender/coordinator of the email, requesting the setup of a Relativity database for the Epstein case and the upload of initial FBI materials.

events.title: Request to Set Up Relativity Database
events.description: An email was sent requesting the setup of a Relativity database for the case U.S. v. Epstein and the upload of initial FBI case files from a specific folder.
personsInvolved: Assistant U.S. Attorney of New York

events.title: Confirmation of Document Upload
events.description: A follow-up email confirms that the requested documents have been uploaded to the Relativity database and are available for review.
personsInvolved: Assistant U.S. Attorney of New York

keyFacts: The document is an email chain from January 2019 concerning the legal case 'U.S. v. Epstein'.
An Assistant U.S. Attorney from New York is coordinating the technical setup of a document review database (Relativity) for the case.
The initial upload consists of FBI case files obtained via a FOIA request related to an investigation labeled 'JSvEpsteiH'.
The correspondence anticipates receiving a large batch of additional case files in the coming weeks.
The email mentions the potential for a future privilege review of some materials, but not for the initial upload.
